reviewText:
Just started playing and am having a pretty good time with this genre blending game. Essentially, you are defending a tower from a variety of enemies.  You have quite a lot of options on defensive items to build between levels, and the action ramps up fairly quickly as you go along.

On the plus side, there are a lot of ways to customize your character with stat boosts and such. Plus the towers are fun to build and deploy. A good bit of strategy there.

On the negative side, if the setting changes, I haven't made it that far yet. I think you stay on the same tower for the entire game for as long as you can survive the waves.  This could become boring for some people after awhile.

Overall, I'm enjoying the game and do recommend it.

Con:

Im really enjoying this game, looking forward for a second part or updates!

reviewText:
Public Review on behalf of the Opium Pulses Steam group
Disclaimer: The copy of this game was provided by the developer for review purposes, yet it doesn't affect my review in any way.

Few words about the game
My Tower, My Home is a nicely done combination of a tower defence game with 2D shooter. It's a very dynamic game where enemies comes from every direction to destroy core of your tower and your goal is to defend it using multiple strategies with ton of perks you can choose from. Try to survive few waves and don't die too quickly ;)

Advantages
A huge variety of mods, upgrades and skills to choose from
Very nice and minimalistic graphics
Co-op mode for 2 local players (I didn't tested it)
Game is quite challenging, as after some waves of enemies it slowly becomes even overwhelming (game offers few difficulties so don't worry)
Disadvantages
Gets pretty repetitive after a while, game unfortunately contains only one map
Game doesn't saves progress nor gives you any kind of boosts or bonuses when you die
Sounds are not polished at all
Summary
Game is overally fun for what it is and yes, might get boring, but before it will happen, you will have some great fun trying to get further and further, trying out different tactics. Idea of blending those few game styles is also a nice thing and as you can all see, it worked out pretty interesting. I really hope that soon we will see an update with some new content to it, I would gladly try it out. So yeah, I had some neat fun playing it, I totally recommend it and I really hope that my review was helpful to you!

Personal score
7.5 / 10
If you find my review helpful or funny be sure to follow Opium Pulses curator page right here for more reviewed games!

reviewText:
The thing that I was most interested about in My Tower, My Home was the combination of an action shooter with a tower defense game. Being a big fan of tower defense games I am always interested in games that try to do something new with the genre. Even though I haven't played the game a ton at this point, I have had fun with the game. The controls work well and if you think the concept sounds interesting, I think you will enjoy the game.

My biggest problem with My Tower, My Home is the difficulty and the fact that you will be replaying the same waves over and over again. While there are quite a few different strategies in the game, some seem to be better than others. Until you find one of these strategies you will die a lot. Being difficult is not necessarily a bad thing but it does force you to keep replaying the same content over and over again as you try to perfect your strategy. If you don't like the idea of playing the same level over and over again, the game may frustrate you.

Overall I had fun with My Tower, My Home. I liked the combination of the 2D action shooter and tower defense genres. If the premise sounds really interesting to you I think you could like My Tower, My Home quite a bit. If you are only curious about the concept though I would probably wait for a sale.

Note: I received a review copy from the developer but received no other compensation for this review.

Read My Full Review [www.geekyhobbies.com]

reviewText:
(NOTE: This title was comes from an indie developer so I tried to keep my expectations mid-range for this review)
(Link to full review: http://culturedvultures.com/game-review-my-tower-my-home )


My Tower My Home is a hybrid game that combines elements of tower defense with platform-style gameplay. As interesting as that sounds I’ll skip right to the punch with this one. This game was a bit of a disappointment. While there are some redeeming traits to this title my initial and lasting reaction can easily be summarized in a single word; incomplete.

In this game you have a tower and must defend it and as the player you control a guy with a gun who can run, jump, shoot baddies and build upgrades for your tower.The game does provide some depth, though it feels as though the developers didn’t go as deep as they should have in some areas. For instance, there is a level system that allows players to selectively upgrade various skills and bonuses to help as the game progresses. It would have been nice had the developers expanded more in the part of the game as it seems like a step in the right direction.

As far as graphics are concerned, I found the visuals to be mediocre. Not the worst but not very impressive either.

I was not overly impressed with the look and feel of the game’s UX. The menus and buttons were a bit clunky and unpolished looking. The turret placing process is sub-optimal and could be improved. Ugly fonts also. I'm very font sensitive.

The number one issue I have with this game is that it just doesn’t seem finished. Not only did it crash almost every time I played it, but it would crash in multiple ways. As a PC gamer I am willing to suffer a few game crashes here and there but there is a line between having a few ‘unhandled exceptions errors’ and having an unstable game. I found it especially frustrating because there were moments I was very ‘into’ the game and it would crash. Total buzz killer.

While I cannot recommend this game in its current state I would encourage the developers not to abandon their efforts on this title. At its core there certainly is a good game here, but my end thoughts are that it needs more development to qualify as a good game entirely.

5/10

reviewText:
I wanna start saying one thing: the game is well made.
I mean, minamilistic but clear and nice graphics, complete interfaces, everything is polished and works fine. I wanted to point this out because, sadly, it's not something to take for granted.
So, these guys did a fantastic job developing the game they wanted to develop, what I really don't get is why someone should want to develop this useless game in the first place! The world didn't need this! I'm sure I didn't! And i have to say i love tower defense games, so I knew what i was looking for.
I mean, this game could be the Pong" of the tower defense genre
